column4: Is changing from a kernel from a 32bit 10.04lts to a 64bit kernel, without doing a new install, likely to take more than a couple hours for someone with decent experience with Linux?  Is there much more than changing the kernel, some basic libraries and a couple other items or is there a massive list (>20 libraries) required to change to 64bit?
You dont just switch to a 64bit system from a 32bit one.
you reinstall to switch to 64bit basically
Good luck with that these days.
